commitResults.messageTitle: Implemented Greetings and commands will be echoed until the user enters 'bye' where the program will exit
Added list functionality where users may store text and display the text they stored by entering 'list'
Added new class for Tasks with class methods to mark tasks as done/undone, get description and get status icon
Added Tasks and ability to mark tasks
Added Deadline/Event/Todo classes
Added tracking of Deadline/Event/Task and counter for lists
Added a new TaskList class that makes use of ArrayLists to store the list of tasks.
Added exception handling to certain cases such as when an InvalidCommand is provided
Added testing using input/output redirection technique
Added delete tasks functionality
Abstract methods out into Duke class and called methods in Main
Add save functionality to Duke.
commitResults.messageBody:
Program will read from duke.txt file in data folder and load the task list accordingly.
If the file/folder does not exist, the program will create a folder/file.
Upon each change to the tasklist, mark/unmark/delete/add, the duke.txt file will be updated.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Date and Time recognition into Deadline tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Upon adding a deadline task, the date/time needs to have the following format:
- yyyy-MM-dd
- dd-MMM-yyyy
- dd/MM/yyyy
- E, MMM dd yyyy

The date will then be converted to 'MMM d yyyy' accordingly

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Date and Time into deadline tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Users may enter dates in the following format: "yyyy-MM-dd, dd-MMM-yyyy, dd/MM/yyyy"
The program will then translate it to this format: "MMM d yyyy"

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix Deadline bugs when converting from data file into list

Extend use of OOP by asbtracting methods into different classes: - Storage: Deals with loading tasks from the file and saving tasks in the file - Ui: Deals with printing messages for the user - Parser: Deals with making sense of the user command
Divide classes into multiple packages
Added Gradle Support
Add JUnit tests for creation of Deadline/Event/Todo tasks
Edit code to follow coding standards
Add JavaDoc comments to classes and methods
Add Find functionality where users may enter a keyword and Duke will return a list of tasks whose description contains the keyword
Fixed Checkstyle errors and added more JavaDocs
Fixed some print statement bugs
Implemented a GUI using JavaFX and refactored classes.
commitResults.messageBody:
Commands is now an interface and the various types of commands are separate classes that implements this interface.
Exceptions have also been reduced to a single DukeException.
UI class now handles the printing of certain errors and greet statement.

commitResults.messageTitle: Made minor changes to some output statements to improve readability
Added Javadocs comments and headers
Added some styling to DialogBox and made sure full output can be viewed.
Add storage of Date and Time to Event Task
commitResults.messageBody:
Users could previously store any String into the /at field of Event task.
This feature limits users to store a proper Date into the Event task,
and converts this date into a standardised date format for better readability.

Let's only allow users to enter their dates for the Event task in the following format:
"yyyy-MM-dd", "dd-MMM-yyyy", "dd/MM/yyyy".
The date will then be stored as "MMM d yyyy".

commitResults.messageTitle: Edit Parser to use String input directly rather than redundant Scanner
Add use of Assertions into TaskList load deadline and event methods.
commitResults.messageBody:
Assertions used to document important assumptions that should hold at that point
so that runtime can verify them. Helps early detection of errors.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve code quality by critically examining and refactoring code.
commitResults.messageBody:
Code quality affects not only run-time effeciency, security, and robustness,
but also improves reader understandability.

Let's,
- Avoid long methods (below 30 LOC)
- Avoid deep nesting and arrowhead style code
- Add default branches for case statements
- Minimise code duplication
- Use guard clauses

commitResults.messageTitle: Add functionality of specifying specific file to load data from.
commitResults.messageBody:
Current data is always pulled and saved from duke.txt file.

Allowing users to specify the file they want to load and save data in allows
them to personalise multiple tasklists and adds more personalisation.

Let's,
- Make default file load and save into duke.txt file
- Allow users to call a new load command to specify the file they want to load
- After successful load, auto-save will occur into the new file instead of duke.txt file

However, current implementation clears tasklist when loading data even when
file is not able to load due to invalid entries which may cause data to be lost.
